titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Clyde De Vane Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Kathy M.U. Straka Lynn J. Stewart

p.extref: Copyright Â© 2012 by the Yale University Library.

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with the Yale EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Professional papers relating to De Vane's research, teaching, and other activities at Yale University. Included are correspondence, writings, speeches, lecture notes, research materials (particularly on Robert Browning), biographical material, and photographs. The academic papers of his wife, Mabel Phillips De Vane, are also part of the collection. They consist chiefly of essays written while she was a graduate student at Yale University, ca. 1925, together with memorabilia and biographical material.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: William Clyde De Vane Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Professional papers relating to De Vane's research, teaching, and other activities at Yale University. Included are correspondence, writings, speeches, lecture notes, research materials (particularly on Robert Browning), biographical material, and photographs. The academic papers of his wife, Mabel Phillips De Vane, are also part of the collection. They consist chiefly of essays written while she was a graduate student at Yale University, ca. 1925, together with memorabilia and biographical material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in three series: I. William C. De Vane. II. Mabel Phillips De Vane. III. Photographs.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence is arranged primarily by individual correspondent, in alphabetical order. The remainder is arranged alphabetically in general files. Most of the correspondence consists of incoming letters.

Writings and Speeches is filed chronologically where a date could be assigned. Undated material is filed alphabetically by the title. Untitled and undated material will be found at the end of the section.
Class Lecture Notes is arranged alphabetically by subject.
Writings of Others is arranged alphabetically by author.

Subject Files is arranged in two sections. Robert Browning material, including various types of research material and correspondence, is arranged by type of material. The publications section consists of correspondence, clippings and an unidentified manuscript fragment. It is arranged by type.
Honors and Citations is arranged chronologically.
Biographical Material is foldered by type of material, and arranged chronologically.
Memorabilia is arranged by type of material.

scopecontent.p: There are five major types of material.

Graduate papers are arranged alphabetically by title of the papers, as few are dated. Writings and speeches are arranged alphabetically by title. Untitled material is at the end of the section. Memorabilia is arranged by type of material.

scopecontent.p: Photographs are not fully processed. They consist primarily of formal and informal photographs of William C. De Vane. They are arranged by subject.
